name: Guyana
description: Guyana, officially the Cooperative Republic of Guyana, is a country in the northernmost part of South America. It’s known for its pristine rainforests, diverse wildlife, and significant mineral resources. The country boasts a rich indigenous heritage and is experiencing rapid development while striving to balance economic growth with environmental sustainability.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, located on the Essequibo River.
quickFacts.detail: Georgetown is a melting pot of cultures, with influences from indigenous, African, Indian, and European communities.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small population contributes to its pristine environment.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population is of mixed descent, with significant populations of indigenous peoples, East Indians, Africans, and Europeans.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: Guyana is the only English-speaking country in South America.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally, 1 USD is approximately 100 GYD.

climateData.title: Guyanese Climate
climateData.description: Guyana experiences a tropical rainforest climate, characterized by high temperatures and humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant and distributed relatively evenly.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This period is marked by heavy rainfall and high humidity. Rivers swell, making travel difficult in some areas.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings lower rainfall and cooler temperatures. It's a popular time for tourism and outdoor activities.

naturalWonders.name: Kaieteur Falls
naturalWonders.description: Kaieteur Falls is one of the world’s most powerful waterfalls, plunging 741 feet (226 meters) into the Potaro River. It’s a truly awe-inspiring sight and a testament to Guyana’s untouched wilderness.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located deep within the rainforest, Kaieteur Falls is accessible by small aircraft. The sheer volume of water cascading over the falls creates a thunderous roar and a perpetual mist.
naturalWonders.bestTime: Year-round, but particularly stunning during the dry season (May-November).

naturalWonders.name: Iwokrama Forest
naturalWonders.description: Iwokrama Forest is a vast, ancient rainforest that spans over 1.3 million hectares. It’s a biodiversity hotspot and a crucial area for conservation efforts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The forest is renowned for its incredible biodiversity, including jaguars, giant river otters, harpy eagles, and numerous tree species. It’s also home to the Iwokrama Canopy Walkway, offering a unique perspective on the rainforest ecosystem.

ecosystemData.title: Guyanese Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Guyana’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from lowland rainforests to savanna woodlands and coastal wetlands. The country is a global leader in rainforest conservation.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of the country's land area is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Guyana is home to a variety of mammals, including jaguars, ocelots, giant river otters, capybaras, and tapirs.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Guyana boasts an incredible diversity of bird species, including macaws, toucans, hummingbirds, and raptors.

statistics.details: Diverse species found throughout the country

activities.title: Guyanese Adventures
activities.description: Guyana offers a wide range of outdoor activities for adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the country’s rainforests and waterfalls on foot.

activities.name: Kaieteur Falls Hike
activities.description: A guided hike to the base of Kaieteur Falls.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, rain gear, insect repellent

activities.name: Iwokrama Canopy Walkway Hike
activities.description: Walk among the rainforest canopy on a suspended walkway.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Experience Guyana’s rivers and waterways through various water sports.

activities.name: River Rafting
activities.description: Raft down the Essequibo or Potaro Rivers.

activities.name: Canoeing
activities.description: Explore the smaller creeks and tributaries by canoe.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses
clothing.winter: Long-sleeved shirts, trousers, fleece jacket, waterproof jacket

equipment.basic: Backpack, water bottle, flashlight, first-aid kit
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
